botanical_details.genus: Vicia are annuals, herbaceous perennials or climbers; leaves may be simple or divided into many small leaflets, often ending in a tendril. The yellow, purple, white or pink, pea-like flowers are produced in small clusters on the stem or in larger, upright sprays

how_to_grow.cultivation: Does best in a sunny, sheltered position with fertile, moist but well-drained soil, though most soils will produce an adequate crop. Sow in February in pots in a cold greenhouse or in March/Apr outdoors. This dwarf cultivar is ideal for container growing or for smaller gardens. See the RHS A-Z guide to vegetable cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.pruning: Picking off the tender tips of the shoots can delay and reduce infestation by black bean aphid, and also improve the yield
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to pea and bean weevil and black bean aphid. Stored seed may be susceptible to broad bean seed beetle
how_to_grow.diseases: May be susceptible to broad bean rust and broad bean chocolate spot
